intro: Ophiorrhiza axillaris, commonly known as the tropical shrub or Indian root, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in tropical and subtropical regions. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils, allowing it to thrive in challenging conditions. Ophiorrhiza axillaris is also noted for its ability to form symbiotic relationships with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing its ecological significance.
